document_title: Finger arthritis: Causes, signs, treatment and prevention
subsection_content:
Exercise regularly: Patients need to regularly perform moderate exercise. This good habit will help you increase your resistance, reduce joint pain and stiffness, and support better blood circulation in your joints.; Don't let your hands work too much: You should take time to rest when you work with your hands too much. This will help patients prevent the risk of finger arthritis.; Keep your body warm: When the weather gets cold, you should pay attention to keeping your body warm to reduce joint pain and stiffness.; Proper handling of stiff finger joints: When stiff finger joints, patients can gently massage or use anti-inflammatory gel to improve this condition, avoiding it affecting daily activities.; Building a healthy diet: You should supplement your menu with food groups rich in calcium, iron, zinc, selenium, vitamins, minerals... Patients need to avoid greasy and spicy foods. Hot, containing stimulants, will affect the body's resistance.
